title: Very usefull
comment: Love the detailed included manual. And the best is that it is free, very usefull in third world countries where some people want to learn and experiment more but lack the funds to buy a top end calculator. Billiant mathematical software like Matlab is pushed in Universities so adapting to the new way of entering commands in Maxima might prevent some users moving. Schools should introduce this free mathamatical tool as part of their curriculum as a lot of people in Africa have phones to load this app.

title: Good app
comment: Thanks you.
I run android 4.3. What's the point of using this app if the download control on the author's website is inoperable?

I really don't understand 'download control on the author's website is inoperable'. Actually, everything is downloaded from Play Store. 
If you have any issue on using it, please drop me an email.

title: Thanks
comment: thanks to mr Y.Honda

title: Great app!!!
comment: It's very handy to be able to do some complex integrals when Mathematica is not available.
Thanks for the update.

title: Works great but,
comment: I wish that it had support for permanently adding user functions.  As for as I can tell, it lacks this functionality.

It DOES support this functionality. Please take a look at 'About MoA' menu and you will find a manual of Maxima on Android. It tells you the support of maxima-init.mac on Android for automatic loading of user functions. Also, you may find how Dropbox can be used to share maxima files between your PC and Maxima on Android.

title: Best CAS for Android!
comment: Started using this after Octave port became nagware. It takes a while to get used to but is breeze once you get to know the commands and syntax. The manual is very helpful and have quite a few examples for almost all the commands. Since the outputs are rendered using MathJax, you can export the output to LaTeX. This makes it great companion to TeXPortal for compiling documents on the go.  Kudos to the developer for bringing Maxima to Android and keeping the spirit of open source! Much appreciated.

title: download a good math keyboard and
comment: No handheld calculator can compare to a powerful smartphone with maxima installed. Thanks for your reply below. Yes I did mean "20*log(x)". So other than a small iput bug that only happens on swype keyboard "SGS5 4.4.4" this program works beautifully. It works like the desktop version of maxima so for someone who is already versed in that will have little to no learning curve. I compare my phone with maxima to my handheld calculators and this wins in every catagory and does super fast complex calculation

Thanks for the bug report. This bug is caused by the combination of a bug of maxima itself and a bug of Maxima on Android. It will take time to fix this. I guess 20*log(x); may be what you want to type instead of 20log(x).

title: No plotting
comment: Very nice app however any attempt to plot results on an blank screen. Test system is Lenovo A5500 / Android 4.4.2.

title: Great to have it on my mobile devices
comment: I am a professional mathematician and use maxima quite often for my work on my Linux systems. It's great to have it on my mobile device as well.

title: working properly now on x86
comment: great work

Hi lokesh,
Would you please contact me directly if you help me debug? 
Thanks!

title: Excellent
comment: Quality software in action!
great.

title: Excellent tool for science
comment: Im a Physicist who uses maxima regular for reseaech

title: Won't yet run on Nexus 9
comment: In general this is a wonderful contribution.  However, it will not presently install on a Nexus 9, instead displaying a pop-up error: "Non supported CPU type: aarch64".  It looks like a re-compilation is needed for the newest processors.
Thanks for let me know that MoA 2.6 does not work on Nexus 9. I would appreciate if you could help me for debugging. If you can, please send me an email directly!

title: Great tool, now usable on Android too
comment: Provides added value over the standard pocket calculator app. ;)

title: Excellent
comment: A full-fledged computer algebra system working just like the version I have on my Linux machine. Great port. Love it!  A normal keyboard is painful to enter math on so do yourself the favour of downloading the (free) Std Math Keyboard by MuCephi.

title: Powerful, needs some improvement
comment: Nice, it can solve more integrals than most Android calculators.  Though some are not solved and can be solved by "Reduce for Android", such as "1/((x-3)^4+1/2)"  . And of course many that can be solved by Mathematica for PC, such as or "sqrt((x+sqrt(1+x^2))/x). It would also be nice to have a GUI with shortcuts for formulas. Another very easy calculation maxima does wrong is:  assume(x>= y, y>= z, z>= x)$ is( x = z ); taylor (sqrt(x), x, 0, 5) returns sqrt(x), that's wrong.
Very good

title: Very useful
comment: Very nce work,Thanks developers.

title: Great
comment: I love maxima and love this app.  It even has the pretty print embedded

title: Same experience as on desktop
comment: Great job! Such a complex piece of software ported on a mobile platform. Neat.
Great maxima

title: Καταπληκτικό!
comment: Amazing! Among the vital few which support scripts.

title: Physics
comment: Love this tool has come in useful for my degree.

title: 7 stars app
comment: If you can develop more -like 2*x^7 more easily to type 2x7(uppercase)- than i will give 10 stars                     PLEASE TO TRY ADDING MAXIMA'S KEYBOARD and button to integrate, differentiate, plot, and many more like free geo or mathrena.      Maybe, you should make some multiple step ahead than other mathematics app.      THANKS A LOT

title: Excellent port of Maxima
comment: Great port of a great system.

title: Maxima is great
comment: Thank you for a good job! I use maxima on my desktop and was pleased to find an Android port. The LaTeX equations are beautiful but a monospaced font would look better for commands.

title: Excellent CAS for your Android devices
comment: Maxima is a great open source computer algebra system, and this is a port to Android platform. It works very well on all my Android (ARM) devices. The developer keeps the spirit of open source. You can download the complete source and compile yourself. (Yes, I successfully built it.) There is another paid app named 'Algebra Solver Maxima' which is suspiciously similar to this one. I wonder whether the developers collaborated.
Thanks for your words. Just to let you know, I don't have any relation to 'Algebra Solver Maxima'.

title: Takes some learning if you're not familiar
comment: BUT who cares because it's worth it. I literally find myself just 3d plotting, evaluating random series' and learning Taylor series' all day long and that's not even all it can do.
perfect

title: Beautiful
comment: Rare and impressive example of exported Lisp project.
great app

title: good
comment: nice
Loved it

title: Workstation-grade symbolic algebra package in my pocket
comment: Maxima is my favourite symbolic algebra system and the author of this particular package has put it all together so it works beautifully on Android systems. The result is a calculator with symbolic and graphical capabilities of worstation-grade. The fact that members of the community can bring existing projects onto new platforms such as Android also brigs out the superior power of Open Source Software beautifully.
Maxima - Best of the rest

title: It's really good to know this software on Android
comment: Incredible... extraordinary... thank Honda to make my Android worthy... sorry that I only can do this review... but this Maxima on Android is powerfull perhaps I will conducted to my student so they can optimize their handheld to become Mathematician... I'm very like this five stars for it...

title: Good
comment: This is great if I need a CAS program when I have no access to Maple on my computer.

title: Very good!
comment: I hope that in the future, the graph plots will be in higher resolution, and the 3D plots can be rotated :)

title: Great maths package
comment: I am doing a physics & a maths degree. I combine this on my Note 3 with apps for Wolfram Alpha, MathStudio & Graph89 (an emulator for my TI89) plus on my PC, Maple & Mathematica. Each good for different tasks.
The very idea of this app is exciting

title: Very useful!
comment: One of the best things on Android. Easy, versatile syntax; renders its output too.

title: The most powerful app there is.
comment: If I could only have one app, the decision would be trivial.  If you're not familiar with Maxima, think open source (therefore open and expandable) Mathematica plus Matlab.  The icing on the cake: this app literally renders its output in TeX!

title: Great calculus app
comment: This app   comes handy when you are working on your calculus lessons. Great porting work to android done by the publisher.

title: A full fledged computer algebra system. Really satisfying.
comment: After searching google play for a long time,  I finally found this marvel. This is a real gem. Beats those costly alternatives in many ways.

title: Gloversville, New York 12078
comment: Thank you !!

title: Wow
comment: This really makes my phone one step closer to Star Trek.
Good
Love it on the fly.
exceptional

title: Full-fledged CAS on Android!
comment: A full-fledged computer algebra system for Android.  Works just like the desktop version and is remarkably well executed.

title: Superb
comment: Excellent work for porting maxima on android. The maxima is awesome. The plotting could use some work though. If we could rotate and interact with the plotted graph that would be great.

title: Excellent
comment: Now we have a system on Android to rival the TI-89 emulators... ;-) Thank you! It would be nice if the gui also showed the input line in graphical form (without having to enter 'term=term). Also, the automatic reflow in the manual is nice, but the horizontal scrollbar should be adapted to the new width.
Excellent

title: Nice port of Maxima
comment: Very nice port. My only wish is a notebook interface compatible with wxmaxima.

title: The real deal
comment: Powerful, well-known CAS with a nice frontend that renders formulas beautifully using MathJax.

title: Impressive performance &  beautiful graphics!
comment: Works great on the Nexus 5!  I use the Hacker's Keyboard in landscape mode with full 5-row layout.  MoA is easy to use if you know Maxima, and the manual is available if you don't.

title: Wow
comment: Usability is limited by the touch keyboard. But it's great (and slightly unreal) to have Maxima on a phone. Thanks a lot!
Impressive but limited usability

title: Force close no matter what I do
comment: I'm using an HTC incredible running cyanogenmod 7. I get a force close using this app as soon as I try to run a command.

title: Doesn't work any more
comment: Wonderful app - but unfortunately last update freezes on any input on my Motorola Razr i. Don't know if this is an Intel vs ARM issue - but it's a shame as I liked having Maxima on my phone!
Muy buena app

title: Great!
comment: Already good, and getting better all the time!  Love it!  Thank you!
Thank you for porting this.

title: Brilliant App
comment: Very well ported app. Works well on my Galaxy S2. The only downside is that you don't seem to be able to rotate 3D plots.

title: Wow
comment: Great, thanks! For real!

title: So so
comment: Would be fine but session restore doesn't restore my variables, and restored input lines can not be touched and so recalled. Also it's really slow and crashes (hangs indefinitely)  from time to time.   Please keep improving.

title: Useful
comment: I use the wonderful WxMaxima on the PC and I was delighted to find an Android version. This saves me a bit of time and is convenient too.

title: Outstanding!
comment: I think that the software works quite well and does every basic function and calculation you would want

title: Awesome!
comment: This app is just amazing. Thank you very much to the author for all his efforts!

title: ssave, srestore, playback
comment: All or one of the following functions ssave, srestore, playback do NOT work properly. All seem to work but the values assign to variables do not appear. I am using Android 2.3 in a Samsung S2. Thanks for your time and consideration.

title: Good port
comment: Please, give the ability to make a font size even smaller and, most importantly, to save a choosen font size between the application launches.

title: Thank you for bringing Maxima to Android!
comment: This is fantastic stuff, I hope the developer keeps improving the app.
Maxima takes a steep learning curve, but is extremely powerful. Great to have it on Android.

title: Fix manual
comment: Please fix the manual this is the best software but the manual is always needed
Exciting

title: Amazing!
comment: What more could you ask for? Turns that magical touchscreen in your pocket into a mathematician
Ubercool

title: Great!
comment: Works wonderfully; especially plotting.

title: Icon
comment: Hi.  I installed your app on my gs3 and it has the default icon for Android system.  Thank you.
Wow what an application

title: Awesome for uni students
comment: This the killer app that got me to upgrade to an android phone. Having maxima in my pocket while on the train or when the laptops flat is great! I can check answers to my homework whenever I'm doing it.  The save, loadfile, stringout and batch commands are pretty oldschool (would be cool to have these automated in menu buttons like wxmaxima) but they work ok for transfering the working from phone to laptop  Having a slide out physical keyboard is pretty good, I couldn't imagine using it wth a soft keyboard (lots of symbols).  Any old phone will do too. I use an old Xperia X10 mini pro.

title: What I've been looking for
comment: Now that it adds semicolons automatically with the last update, it's even better.

title: Help does not open
comment: Great port of Maxima. The equations render very smoothly. However the help does not open. It seems that the path is not correct. For this 4 stars.

title: Problem with last update
comment: The program can't find the manual pages.
Magic

title: Amazing
comment: Almost as powerful as Mathematica. Thanks!

title: Fantastic
comment: Now I feel that the decision to go with Android Nexus 7 is fully justified. The developer has made a fantastic job in porting this to Android and for me the functionality found on Windows 7 seems to be all there. I like the plotting and drawing facilities available, particularly the world maps features. I also tried out fractals. It's very good to develop ideas on the Nexus and then expand them on the PC. Can't wait to see version 1.7.

title: Wonderful
comment: Having Maxima available on a tablet or smartphone is wonderful. In my view, this is the first fully featured CAS available for either Android or the other system. It deserves every support from its users. I can see room for improvement in the interface, but that in no way detracts from the excellence of the software. For example, what other tablet software will allow you to perform Gröbner basis computations (as I did a few days ago)? This is the best thing I've seen for ages.

title: Does not display Menu on either my devices
comment: I can't find the menu on my Nexus 7 or Galaxy Nexus, So I can't see the documentation and dont know how to use it or quit.
Why internet?

title: New save is VERY nice
comment: Any chance of making save automatic? E.g. asave() function. Also app REALLY needs a dedicated keyboard so a user doesn't have to hunt through four keyboard screens.

title: Cas on android
comment: Amazinglingly helpful. Pretty much everything works. Solve your math problems on the go with this app! :)
great work

title: Great software, quite a alpha implementation
comment: This is a nice effort and I will definitely keep an eye on it because this will be very useful to many of us, however please note that this is still in absolutely alpha stage with huge loading time, poor interface and pretty limited.

title: Ein Traum wurde wahr
comment: Das top CAS Programm endlich unter Android

title: Works as described, usability still needs work
comment: If you known Maxima already and you can enter the maxima syntax without errors, this is fine for you. If you make any mistake or don't know the syntax, this software has zero value for you.  There's no online help or guide or tutorial. If you forget the last semicolon, the only hint you get is "Syntax error. Please correct." - automatically adding missing closing parenthesis and semicolon would be a nice feature. Perhaps show a toast that the input was automatically modified. Also worth noting is lack of saving anything. Everything the user has done is thrown away any time Android needs more memory and Maxima is not the visible software.

title: Maxima does work on a Samsung Note 10.1
comment: Great job! Kudos!
Excellent!

title: One of the best CAS now available on Android!
comment: Maxima is a really magnificent and useful program, and having it on my Nexus 7 is really helpful. A big thank you to the developer to make such an amazing piece of software available for free. I really wish the author would make a donation version just to show our support.

title: very  good
comment: I never  expected someone plants maxima on android, but right  now is  here.

title: the best aplication for computer algebra system
comment: We have maxima in ours mobiles,..... nice, and today we can do graphics in maxima for android yeahhhhhh!!!, .....,  but how can we save a graph in jpg format? , and we can do minimum square adjust for lines and cuadratic functions? please give us more examples  or a link for  a brief  guide maxima for mobiles.
Nexus 7 - works super :-)

title: Good app
comment: Works great so far.

title: Doesn't work on ICS Galaxy Note as of Oct 1
comment: This is a great project.  It currently won't install on my rooted ICS Galaxy Note.  Full 5 stars when app is fully functional.  If useful I am more than willing to test app.  Will check out mailing board for latest situation.  Keep up the great work!

title: Works on phone, not on tablet
comment: This works just great on my DroidX2, but I can't seem to get it to work on my Toshiba Thrive. My preference would be to get it to work on the tablet.

title: UI not usable yet on Galaxy Tab
comment: The UI is comfortable and easy-to-use on my Galaxy Pad 2 7.0, except that there appears to be no way to recall a previous line to the output.  I did not try to read and write Maxima files.  But when I switched to another app and came back to Maxima, all of my work disappeared.  This behavior happened for a few hours, and now the application is completely unusable (it just locks up when I start it.)  This project looks very promising.  It's just not usable yet.  (Tried Version 1.4 on a Galaxy Tab 2 7.0)

title: Great project
comment: And getting ready to open source! Once the code is out, this will go far.

title: cool app
comment: what an effort and dedication.. love this app

title: Great!
comment: Wat I had been waiting for! Maybe could use AddiPlot for graphics?

title: Awesome!
comment: This is realy awesome! You really did great and useful job, I'm ready to donate right now :)  Actually, my smartphone now is ten times faster, than PC which I executed maxima the first time...

title: I LOVE IT!!!
comment: I've been waiting with patience for my favorite CAS (Computer Algebraic System) Maxima to be ported to Android, and am thrilled with it. Well done Yasuaki Honda!!!!!!! :)

title: great app!!!
comment: AMAZING! I was looking for a good calc app but no one suited me really, there are some goods but lack on something, then I discovered that maxima has app to android, pretty good!, the best program ever made.

title: amazing
comment: just amazing, maxima can run on android device now

title: Excellent
comment: Excellent job! Was long waiting for a port to Android OS!

title: すばらしい
comment: Maximaが使えるというだけでAndroid端末の価値が何十倍にもなる。 とてもすばらしい。 作者に心から感謝したい。

title: Excellent work in the early stage
comment: It works great and seems to be very promising.  Very impressive nice math typesetting.  The immediately improvement (IMHO) may be:  1. Auto scroll the screen up: the new results may be hidden "under" the current view.  Either the new results need to be manually scrolled up or it was blocked by on-screen keyboard.  You cannot see the result immediately.  (I thought it was not running the 1st time)  2. Recognize and open some text Maxima file (such as saved entry from wxMaxima, .wxm file).  Then save the current session in the compatible text form.  3. Keyboard history:  although one can use some Clipboard management Apps to help.  Please keep up with this great piece of work!
